metadata.title: CSCS Health & Safety Sample Questions
metadata.description: Sample revision questions for CSCS certification exam covering health and safety on UK building sites
metadata.author: Sample Content

questions.question: What is the main reason for wearing a hard hat on a construction site?
answers: To protect your head from falling objects
To comply with company uniform policy
questions.explanation: Hard hats are essential PPE designed to protect your head from falling objects, bumps, and other head injuries on construction sites.

questions.question: What should you do if you discover a damaged power tool on site?
answers: Report it and do not use it
Hide it so no one else uses it
questions.explanation: Damaged power tools must be reported immediately and taken out of service. Never use faulty equipment as it could cause serious injury or death.

questions.question: What is the recommended maximum weight for a person to lift manually?
answers: There is no set limit - it depends on the individual and circumstances
questions.explanation: There is no single safe weight limit. What is safe depends on factors including the load characteristics, working conditions, and individual capability. Risk assessment is essential.

questions.question: At what height does work become 'working at height' under UK regulations?
answers: Any height where a person could fall and be injured
Only when using ladders or scaffolding
questions.explanation: Working at height means working anywhere where a person could fall a distance liable to cause personal injury, regardless of the specific height. This could even be at ground level near an excavation.

questions.question: What does this sign indicate?

image.alt: Blue circular sign with white pictogram of safety glasses
image.caption: Mandatory safety sign

questions.explanation: Blue circular signs with white pictograms indicate mandatory actions. This sign means eye protection must be worn in this area.

questions.question: If you discover a fire on site, what is the first thing you should do?
answers: Try to put it out yourself
questions.explanation: The first priority on discovering a fire is to raise the alarm so that everyone can evacuate safely. Only attempt to fight the fire if you are trained and it is safe to do so.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a risk assessment?
answers: To identify hazards and reduce risks
To find out who to blame if something goes wrong
questions.explanation: Risk assessments identify hazards and evaluate the risks, allowing appropriate control measures to be implemented to prevent accidents and injuries.

questions.question: What does COSHH stand for?
answers: Control of Substances Hazardous to Health
Control of Site Hazards and Health
Company Standards for Health and Hygiene
Control of Scaffolding and Hoisting Heights
questions.explanation: COSHH stands for Control of Substances Hazardous to Health. These regulations require employers to control substances that are hazardous to health.

questions.question: Who is responsible for safety on a construction site?
answers: Only the health and safety officer
questions.explanation: Everyone has a responsibility for safety on site. While managers and supervisors have specific duties, all workers must take reasonable care of their own safety and that of others.

questions.question: What color are fire exit signs in the UK?
questions.explanation: Fire exit signs in the UK are green with white pictograms and text. Green indicates safe conditions or emergency escape routes.

questions.question: When should safety boots with steel toe caps be worn?
answers: At all times on a construction site
Only when required by your supervisor
questions.explanation: Safety boots with protective toe caps should be worn at all times on construction sites to protect feet from falling objects, sharp materials, and other hazards.

questions.question: What should you do if you are asked to do work that you think is unsafe?
answers: Do the work quickly to get it over with
Refuse to do the work and report your concerns
Do the work but complain afterwards
Ask a colleague to do it instead
questions.explanation: You have the right to refuse unsafe work. Report your concerns to your supervisor immediately. Safety always comes first, and you cannot be dismissed for raising genuine safety concerns.

questions.question: What is the voltage of the recommended safe electrical supply for power tools on construction sites?
questions.explanation: 110 volts is the recommended safe voltage for electrical equipment on construction sites. This lower voltage significantly reduces the risk of serious injury from electric shock.

questions.question: What does a triangular yellow sign with a black border indicate?
questions.explanation: Triangular yellow signs with black borders and symbols are warning signs. They alert you to potential hazards such as electrical risks, moving vehicles, or slippery surfaces.

questions.question: What is the safest way to descend a ladder?
answers: Facing the ladder, maintaining three points of contact
questions.explanation: Always face the ladder when ascending or descending, and maintain three points of contact (two hands and one foot, or two feet and one hand) at all times.
